intro: Psychotria schumanniana, commonly known as Schumann's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria schumanniana is also notable for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
